channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Major Unions Are Dropping Cuomo to Back Mamdani in N.Y.C. Mayor’s Race
item.description: The powerful hotel workers union and Local 32BJ are switching their endorsements to Zohran Mamdani, a sign that Democratic power brokers are coalescin...

item.title: CEO of Oura has 4 predictions for the $80 billion wearable tech industry—including growing his customer base by millions of people
item.description: “The amount of data is getting bigger and broader," says CEO of Oura Tom Hale.

item.title: University of Virginia President Resigns Under Pressure From Trump Administration
item.description: The Justice Department had demanded that James E. Ryan step down in order to help resolve a civil rights investigation into the school.

item.title: Fortune 500 giants Nike and Walmart are warning of upcoming price hikes, but tariff-wary Americans are already pulling back on spending
item.description: A key inflation gauge moved higher in May in the latest sign that prices remain stubbornly elevated.

item.title: Nvidia breakout puts $4 trillion market value within reach
item.description: Nvidia shares have rallied back to a record.

item.title: How Amazon and Walmart’s retail dominance could be disrupted by ChatGPT and Perplexity
item.description: Serial e-commerce entrepreneur, and ReFiBuy founder, Scot Wingo lays out the vision.

item.title: The S&P 500 has retaken all-time highs. Here’s how much European and Chinese stocks raced ahead while U.S. markets regained lost ground
item.description: Where would the S&P 500 be today if Trump hadn't shocked Wall Street with much steeper-than-expected tariffs?

item.title: Supreme Court Punts Decision on Louisiana Voting Map Until Next Term
item.description: The justices asked that the case, which has implications for the political power of Black voters, be reargued next term.

item.title: A Runestone That May Be North America’s Oldest Turns Up in a Canada Forest
item.description: Researchers spent years quietly studying a stone carved with 255 runes and the image of a boat found in Ontario. Now, revealing the stone’s existence,...

item.title: Getty Villa Is Reopening in Los Angeles After Palisades Fire
item.description: Although the museum’s artwork was unscathed, roughly 1,400 trees on the property burned during the Palisades fire. Visible traces of the devastation a...

item.title: Pro-Palestinian Activists Arrested Under Terrorism Law in U.K. Air Base Break-In
item.description: The powers used against the members of a group called Palestine Action are more usually employed in cases of planned jihadist or far-right violence.

item.title: A Runestone That May Be North America’s Oldest Turns Up in a Canada Forest
item.description: Researchers spent years quietly studying a stone carved with 255 runes and the image of a boat found in Ontario. Now, revealing the stone’s existence,...

item.title: Starmer Backtracks on Planned Social Cuts After Pushback From His Own Party
item.description: The British prime minister had pressed ahead with the proposal, but a parliamentary vote on it was expected to fail.

item.title: Israel Suggests It Could Strike Iran Again to Counter New Threats
item.description: Israel’s defense minister said Israel would strike if Iran seeks to develop long-range missiles or advance its nuclear program, despite a truce.

item.title: London Man Who Killed a Boy With a Samurai Sword Receives Life Sentence
item.description: Prosecutors said Marcos Arduini Monzo experienced a drug-induced psychosis before going on a 20-minute rampage through the residential streets of nort...
